frontend.title: Frontend
frontend.description: Frontend refers to the client-side part of web development that involves designing and creating the user interface of a website or web application using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

html.title: HTML
html.description: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is used on the frontend and gives the structure to the webpage which you can style using CSS and make interactive using JavaScript..
html.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

css.title: CSS
css.description: CSS or Cascading Style Sheets is the language used to style the frontend of any website. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and JavaScript.
css.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project1.title: Project Ideas
project1.description: Now that you have learnt HTML and CSS, here are a few ideas for you to build:- Try to copy the design of a website that you like.
project1.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

js.title: JavaScript
js.description: JavaScript allows you to add interactivity to your pages. Common examples that you may have seen on the websites are sliders, click interactions, popups and so on.
js.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project2.title: Project Ideas
project2.description: Here are few ideas to practice your skills:
project2.subtitle: 1. Create a simple to-do list app that allows users to search, add, edit, and delete items. Use local storage to store the data.  2.Create a basic calculator app that allows users to perform basic arithmetic operations.

npm.title: NPM
npm.description: npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language maintained by npm, Inc. npm is the default package manager for the JavaScript runtime environment Node.js.
npm.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project3.title: Project Ideas
project3.description: Regarding projects, here are a few ideas that you can try:
project3.subtitle: Create a simple webpage that shows the current time of user. You can use use dayjs to get the current time and display it on the page.

git/github.title: GIT/GITHUB
git/github.description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency. GitHub is a provider of Internet hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.
git/github.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

bootstrap.title: Bootstrap
bootstrap.description: Bootstrap is a popular front-end framework used to create responsive and visually appealing websites and web applications. It provides a set of pre-designed components, styles, and JavaScript plugins that make it easier for developers to build user interfaces and ensure consistent and responsive design across different devices and screen sizes.
bootstrap.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project4.title: Project Ideas
project4.description: Create a weather app that allows users to get the current weather information for any location. The app will fetch weather data from a weather API and display it in a user-friendly and visually appealing manner.

react.title: React
react.description: React is the most popular front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces. React can also render on the server using Node and power mobile apps using React Native.
react.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project5.title: Project Ideas
project5.description: E-commerce Website: Build a basic e-commerce website with product listings, product details, a shopping cart, and a checkout process. You can use React Router for navigation between pages.

backend.title: Backend
backend.description: In the context of web development, the backend, also known as the server-side, refers to the part of a web application that handles the server-side logic, data processing, and communication with the database. It works behind the scenes to manage and process data, interact with the database, and respond to client requests.

node.title: Node.js
node.description: Node.js is an open-source and cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment. It is a popular tool for almost any kind of project! Node.js runs the V8 JavaScript engine, Google Chromeâ€™s core, outside the browser. This allows Node.js to be very performant. A Node.js app runs in a single process, without creating a new thread for every request. Node.js provides a set of asynchronous I/O primitives in its standard library that prevent JavaScript code from blocking and generally, libraries in Node.js are written using non-blocking paradigms, making blocking behavior the exception rather than the norm.
node.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project6.title: Project Ideas
project6.description: At this point you should be able to build CLI applications using Node.js or whatever backend programming language you picked. You should be able to build a CLI application that can: Read and write files, Parse command line arguments, Make HTTP requests, Parse JSON,Use a third-party library (e.g. a library for parsing CSV files).Use a third-party API
project6.subtitle: Create a CLI application that takes a URL and a CSS selector arguments and prints the text content of the element that matches the selector. Hint you can use

express.title: EXPRESS.JS
express.description: Express.js is a popular and lightweight web application framework for Node.js. It provides a robust set of features and tools to build web applications and APIs quickly and efficiently. Express.js simplifies the process of handling HTTP requests, routing, middleware integration, and response management, making it a preferred choice for creating server-side applications in Node.js.
express.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project7.title: Project Ideas
project7.description: Todo List App: Create a full-fledged todo list application with features like adding tasks, marking them as completed, and deleting tasks.

databases.title: Database
databases.description: In web applications, databases are essential for storing and managing data. When building applications with Express.js, you have multiple options for databases, including both SQL and NoSQL databases.
databases.subtitle: 1. MySQL: MySQL is a popular open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) that uses SQL for querying and managing data. It's known for its stability, reliability, and strong community support. 2. PostgreSQL: PostgreSQL is another powerful open-source RDBMS known for its advanced features, extensibility, and support for complex data types. It's often used for data-heavy applications. 3. MongoDB: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database that stores data in a JSON-like format called BSON (Binary JSON). It's known for its flexibility, scalability, and ease of use, especially for applications with unstructured or semi-structured data.

MONGOdB.title: MONGOdB
MONGOdB.description: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database that stores data in a JSON-like format called BSON (Binary JSON). It's known for its flexibility, scalability, and ease of use, especially for applications with unstructured or semi-structured data.
MONGOdB.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

MySQL.title: MySQL
MySQL.description: MySQL is an incredibly popular open source relational database management system (RDBMS). MySQL can be used as a stand-alone client or in conjunction with other services to provide database connectivity. The M in LAMP stack stands for MySQL; that alone should provide an idea of its prevalence.
MySQL.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

PostgreSQL.title: PostgreSQL
PostgreSQL.description: PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance.
PostgreSQL.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Oracle.title: Oracle
Oracle.description: Oracle Database Server or sometimes called Oracle RDBMS or even simply Oracle is a world leading relational database management system produced by Oracle Corporation.
Oracle.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project8.title: Project Ideas
project8.description: 1. Social Media Platform: Develop a simple social media platform where users can create posts, follow other users, like posts, and comment on them. 2. E-commerce Store: Create an e-commerce website where users can browse products, add them to the cart, and make purchases. Implement features like user authentication, product categories, and order history.

rest.title: REST
rest.description: REST, or REpresentational State Transfer, is an architectural style for providing standards between computer systems on the web, making it easier for systems to communicate with each other.
rest.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

jwt.title: JWT
jwt.description: JWT stands for JSON Web Token is a token-based encryption open standard/methodology that is used to transfer information securely as a JSON object. Clients and Servers use JWT to securely share information, with the JWT containing encoded JSON objects and claims. JWT tokens are designed to be compact, safe to use within URLs, and ideal for SSO contexts.
jwt.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

project9.title: Project Ideas
project9.description: At this point, you should have everything that you need to build a complete application that: Has a responsive frontend that users can interact with, Has a backend API that is secured with JWT authentication, Has a database that stores data
project9.subtitle: Build a simple blogging application where users can register, login, setup their blog and write posts.

internet.title: Internet
internet.description: The Internet is a global network of computers connected to each other which communicate through a standardized set of protocols.
internet.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

python.title: Python
python.description: Python is a well known programming language which is both a strongly typed and a dynamically typed language. Being an interpreted language, code is executed as soon as it is written and the Python syntax allows for writing code in functional, procedural or object-oriented programmatic ways.
python.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Java.title: Java
Java.description: Java is general-purpose language, primarily used for Internet-based applications. It was created in 1995 by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems and is one of the most popular options for backend developers.
Java.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Go.title: Go
Go.description: Go is an open source programming language supported by Google. Go can be used to write cloud services, CLI tools, used for API development, and much more.
Go.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Rust.title: Rust
Rust.description: Rust is a modern systems programming language focusing on safety, speed, and concurrency. It accomplishes these goals by being memory safe without using garbage collection.
Rust.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

GitLab.title: GitLab
GitLab.description: GitLab is a provider of internet hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.
GitLab.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Bitbucket.title: Bitbucket
Bitbucket.description: Bitbucket is a Git based hosting and source code repository service that is Atlassianâ€™s alternative to other products like GitHub, GitLab etc. Bitbucket offers hosting options via Bitbucket Cloud (Atlassianâ€™s servers), Bitbucket Server (customerâ€™s on-premise) or Bitbucket Data Centre (number of servers in customers on-premise or cloud environment)
Bitbucket.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Testing.title: Testing
Testing.description: A key to building software that meets requirements without defects is testing. Software testing helps developers know they are building the right software. When tests are run as part of the development process (often with continuous integration tools), they build confidence and prevent regressions in the code.
Testing.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Integration.title: Integration Testing
Integration.description: Integration testing is a broad category of tests where multiple software modules are integrated and tested as a group. It is meant to test the interaction between multiple services, resources, or modules. For example, an APIâ€™s interaction with a backend service, or a service with a database
Integration.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Unit.title: Unit Testing
Unit.description: Unit testing is where individual units (modules, functions/methods, routines, etc.) of software are tested to ensure their correctness. This low-level testing ensures smaller components are functionally sound while taking the burden off of higher-level tests. Generally, a developer writes these tests during the development process and they are run as automated tests.
Unit.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:

Functional.title: Functional Testing
Functional.description: Functional testing is where software is tested to ensure functional requirements are met. Usually, it is a form of black box testing in which the tester has no understanding of the source code; testing is performed by providing input and comparing expected/actual output. It contrasts with non-functional testing, which includes performance, load, scalability, and penetration testing.
Functional.subtitle: Visit the following resources to learn more:
